intro: Corispermum lehmannianum, commonly known as Lehmann's sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming annual that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has small, green, succulent leaves and produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers. Its seeds are encased in a hard, dry fruit known as a capsule. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
